intro: Houstonia floridana, commonly known as the Florida bluets, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and wetlands. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Houstonia floridana plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
